results.description:
"Everything you don't like about speed dating...we take that out".

Come join us for a new approach to speed dating. We offer participants a series of fun, lively and engaging, pre-written questions in a comfortable environment that helps move potential matches beyond the realm of small talk, as they gain insight into the personalities and the intimate character traits of their speed dates.
results.name: Structured Speed Dating

results.description:
Hey everyone, 

This is a test Meetup Group.

This group brings together all the talented female musicians of Livonia! Whatever your level and your music background, we would love you to join our fun and creative jam sessions. We meet once a week at the Livonia Music Institute and each session is about 2 hours long. Please bring your instrument with you. This is a wonderful chance to inspire and be inspired by other female musicians while creating new bonds through music!
results.name: Female Musicians of Livonia

results.description:
Let's get together to swap different meals/dinners. Sure beats eating leftovers every day of the week or doing all the cooking by yourself! It will also be a motivation to cook healthy, wholesome meals vs. take-out which becomes too easy... We're open in this group to vegetarian, vegan,  meat / non-vegetarian meals...whatever you want. Healthier is of course better, but cook what you want. Great way to save money, save time and stay healthy!

General guidelines for this group:

1.  Bring meals already prepared.

2.  Spend no more than $5.00/meal, we are trying to save $.

3.  Prepare enough servings for as many people RSVP’d for that particular meetup.

4.  Please make a WHOLE meal.

5.  Have meals sorted into individual Tupperware containers (We can reuse them for every swap. Tip: You can buy cheap reusable containers on Amazon: http://tinyurl.com/o42ve68).

6.  You may bring frozen meals, just provide reheating instructions.

7.  Be on time! – If you are late, others may have already left.

8.  If you RSVP’d, please make sure that you are able to make it to the meetup. Everyone went to a lot of trouble to make a specific amount of meals, please be respectful of that and show up!
results.name: Brooklyn Meal Swap

results.description:
Anyone new or relatively new to NYC in their 20's-30's looking to meet new people and make new friends. I'm hoping to setup fun/relaxed happy hours, weekend brunches, and group diners for young professionals so we can all enjoy and explore the city.

I'm going to do my best to keep the events on the smaller side from a headcount perspective in order to allow everyone at the specific events to get to know one another and I'll also try to keep it balanced with guys and girls.
results.name: NYC Newbies 20's-30's

topics.name: Downhill Skiing, XC Skiing, Snowshoe, Snowboarding

results.description: Ski Season is almost here! Let's go skiing. This group is for the skier who doesnt want to go far - just a day trip to Windham/Hunter and it's cool! Tired of getting up at 4:30am to catch a bus for an overpriced day trip to Windham or Hunter? Problem solved! Let's carpool from the Westchester/Rockland/Lower Fairfield area for a casual day trip to Windham or Hunter. Let's leave at 9am and get a half-day ticket. Or ski a full day and still leave at 8am! Both ski areas are just over 2 hrs from the Westchester area and provide enough variety on the slope or off the slopes. No need to rush home after a day of skiing.......let's listen to some music in the lodge and relax before heading out. The goal of this group is to have meetups at local Westchester bars so we can meet other ski buddies and arrange carpools so we can all ski together. And also to have a drink or 2! If you're into hanging out at the lodge, thats cool too....no need to be a skier. For those with weekend houses in the Windham/Hunter area, this is a great way to meet other skiers to ski with from the Westchester area.
results.name: Skiers Over 40 - Day Trips to Windham/Hunter-Let's Carpool!

results.description:
When first signing up for ID purpose please provide a photo of yourself in your profile thank you. We are a group who enjoy cycling the rails to trails in Bronx, Westchester, Putnam Counties and beyond.  The trails for the most part are paved black topped and shaded with beautiful trees. There are no cars or motorcycles allowed on this trail. Also the group will be providing Cycling tours through out the season.When a Meet Up is posted, there is a meeting location and a destination provided. We ride at set pace without pressure. As a group we try to stay together and enjoy the company of others. These trails provide some of the most beautiful landscape that's seen in New York State.

We are not a professional organization, just a group who has a shared interest in cycling and enjoys the outdoors. When you RSVP “YES” for an event, you agree to be responsible for you and your ( guest) and your own safety & equipment. Understand you may not hold anyone liable for accidents, injuries or events in the group.
results.name: All County Social Cycling Club Of New York

results.description:
Hey Basketball Boot Campers, 

I'm Coach Trevor Huffman, the director of King Hoops NYC and part of our new concept that is one part Soul Cycle, one part fitness Boot Camp, and lastly, one part WNBA training camp for female (only) athletes that want to get off the treadmill, elliptical, or row machine and get into amazing shape working out with a group of ladies that all want to grow as people, basketball players, and mostly, athletes. 

 With over 20 years combined experience working in specialized sports performance academies, playing and training in the NBA and top European leagues (for 12 years), our King Hoops NYC's staff look forward to getting you back to Prime Time fitness status. 

Get pumped with our inspiring music, and burn more calories than you can dream of by executing fast paced basketball drills, competing in shooting and dribbling skill development drills, and jumping into full body workouts with medicine balls, bands, and plyometrics!

King Hoops NYC's goal is to get you back into shape (or in game shape) and have as much fun as possible while we do it!

I look forward to meeting and starting the rewarding journey of growth in your personal and athletic lives!

Best, 

 Coach T

PS. If you are an intermediate to advanced player and want to join CO-ED Adult Basketball Bootcamp and meet some great people, join here: http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Adult-Basketball-Boot-Camp/
results.name: Women's Fitness Basketball Boot Camp

results.description:
Does TensorFlow have the potential to become the engine behind most successful consumer and industrial products of the next 10-20 years? 

Absolutely! A much better question is how, and in what new ways, can we:

a) train more computers to teach themselves by sifting through massive amounts of data coming out of all sorts of places

b) make these computers available through an API to provide a high-quality answer to anyone who is in need. 

Why? Because everyone in need deserves the right answer. 

So.... why don't we standardize & democratize the field with and around TensorFlow, and help change the world!?

What. We are a local micro community of those interested in advancing their knowledge of TensorFlow, its use cases and applications.

How. Join our group for a regular dose of human interaction, conversations, smiles, food and drinks on all things TensorFlow:

• How-To's & Best Practices

• Tutorials

• Models

• Algorithms

• Multi-GPU Autoscaling in the cloud

• Tools & Integrations

We will learn how others solve some of the hard problems that exist in the world around us, and how others make predictive APIs and applications.

Join the movement. Let’s change the world. Because everyone in need deserves the right answer.

You are welcome:)
results.name: TensorFlow New York City

results.description: This group is for fun, easy going, philosophical discussion about who we are and what the universe is. Topics like God, science, mathematics, personal identity are just a few of the topics discussed. I am the author of the book, "The Universe from Nothing to Love." Reading this 4 page book (Amazon) will give you insight into deep truths about our universe, but is NOT required to be part of the discussion. I hope to see people of all religions and non religious people (atheist) come together and talk about our knowable universe.

results.description: Welcome to the Mount Vernon Running Club Meetup! This meetup is intended to develop a strong running community within the city of Mount Vernon, NY. This group is available for runners of all levels, ages and ethnicities committed to the sport of running. Whether your goal is to start running, preparing for a marathon, wanting to become a healthier you or to get outdoors more, this meetup should provide to be an excellent resource. Please join me as I work on changing this journey from a few to hopefully a few thousands of MV Runners, racing together across the finish line. Thanks for taking the time to check us out. Hope to see you soon!!
results.name: Mount Vernon Running Club

results.description:
A Meetup group for people who are interested in attending performing arts events and meeting other people with similar interests. Would you like to explore the arts in NYC but have a hard time getting your friends to join you? Do you find that the cost of tickets stops you from exploring less well-known material? This is the ideal group for you! Events will include live theater, dance, music, etc. Only professional performances at respected institutions will be included as official Meetup events. Tickets will always be free or significantly discounted so members can try things and not worry about the cost. Let's build a community centered around the arts!

About the Organizer: I am a longtime arts professional with a large network of friends in theaters, marketing firms, and press agencies throughout the city. I receive a lot of offers for free or inexpensive tickets through these people. I am passionate about introducing new people to this world. I also enjoy meeting new friends who like to get out of the house and participate in activities. 

I hope for this to be a relaxed, friendly group. All are welcome and encouraged to join!

Please read the policies below to get an idea of what to expect. If you have any other questions, feel free to message me. 


Costs: Unless otherwise noted, all events are free. There is a $10 processing fee for each ticket to cover the venue's box office administrative fees. The fee also helps to ensure that people who RSVP actually attend the event because the venue is assigning seats for us that would otherwise go to paying guests. 

RSVP Policy: Please only RSVP if you're sure you can attend. The events will be small with a limited number of tickets. If you're not sure you can come please let someone else have the seat.  No-shows or late changes to your RSVP without explanation may result in being removed from the group. These are live events with assigned start times. You must be on time or you will be considered a no-show.  The event fee must be paid within 24-48 hours of signing up (depending on how soon the event is). Fees are non-refundable. Basically, be polite to fellow members and you'll be fine. 

Age policy: Members outside the 21-35 age range are welcome to join; but they may not qualify for all events. Some may be 21+ or specifically targeted to young patrons. Please read the event descriptions carefully to make sure there are no age restrictions for that specific event. Members and their guests MUST be 18 years or age or over, without exception.
results.name: Live Entertainment Meetup Group (Ages 21-35)

results.description: This group is for people that enjoy going out having a wonderful time without any drama. We will be charging $1.00 for most events that members attend, this money will be used for annual dues, supplies for house parties and special functions just to name a few. As people join the group a complimentary event will be take place for the members of Entertainment Club of NJ.

results.description: The aim of this meetup is to foster competitive scrabble play in a meetup setting. This encompasses scrabble play with clocks, challenges and no looking in the dictionary before you play a word. I have enough equipment for four players or two games. The idea of this meetup is an alternative from playing scrabble online. When people play online there is no supervision so you don't know if the game is legitimate or not. The rules: 25:00 in a standard scrabble game for each opponent. If you go over your clock a minute you are penalized ten points even if it is one second. This event will be held at the Greenhouse Cafe at 7717 3rd Ave Brooklyn NY 11209 7-10:30 pm alternate Tuesdays. Directions are the R train to 77th street and walk one block south to third avenue. The B37 also stop right in front of the establishment. My name is Kris I hope to see you there.
results.name: Tournament Style Scrabble Meetup (competitive not social)

To find out more, visit our website...  www.tzmnyc.com

results.description: This is a group for anyone in their 20's, 30's or 40's who supports the mission of Project Music (see below). The group will provide an opportunity to meet like-minded people, socialize and network - all while contributing to a fantastic cause. We will have happy hours, live music events, fundraising drives, and chances to witness the amazing positive influence the program has on its students. Project Music is a free intensive after-school music education program for students in Stamford, Connecticut. The program is inspired by Venezuela’s “music education miracle” known as El Sistema, a program for social change created over 30 years ago. PROJECT MUSIC provides music education, instruments, and mentorship to Stamford youngsters. PROJECT MUSIC is intended not only to provide musical instruments and training, but also to address some of the extensive social challenges affecting Stamford’s youth. To this end, we use music to cultivate fundamental life skills such as self-expression, cooperative learning, discipline, leadership, and creativity— all of which have been linked to improved social and academic outcomes. The program fills a gap in accessible quality music education and after­school care in the City of Stamford.
results.name: Project Music - Young Leadership Network - Stamford

results.description:
We want to build a community for current and prospective Udacity students of all Nanodegree programs to gather together and advance their education. 

Our mission is to bring accessible, affordable, engaging, and highly effective higher education to the world. We believe that higher education is a basic human right, and we seek to empower our students to advance their education and careers. Education is no longer a one-time event but a lifelong experience. Education should be less passive listening (no long lectures) and more active doing. Education should empower students to succeed not just in school but in life.

We gather a few times a month to work through course content as well as host interesting events such as speaker series and hack-a-thons that take learning beyond the virtual classroom. Can't wait to see you soon!

The Udacity NYC Meetup is a flat organization, meaning we are not a "top-down" hierarchy. Members should feel free to suggest Meetup topics and events. Members who consistently demonstrate their dedication to the group may be given some moderator powers, which include the ability to create and host events.

"Dude, remember the golden rule - be excellent to each other.' Bill & Ted
results.name: Udacity NYC Meetup

results.description: The Tri-State Entrepreneurship Meetup are for those in the Tri-State Area who are interested in taking control of their financial situations and achieve their goals and dreams. ONLY ENTREPRENEUR MINDED PEOPLE CAN JOIN!!!

results.description: Veteran's Helping Hands (vetohh) was formed in August 2015 by a Veteran facing a challenging transition. With the support of family and friends, she created Veteran's Helping Hands to reach out to other Veterans who are in the same situation as her. Vetohh serves as a support system for Veterans starting over in a new city. Vetohh organized the #thankourVets grassroot open source movement dedicated to raise Veteran transition awareness, promote Veteran benefits reform and support research on Veteran re-integration. Through a network of public-private partnerships, Veteran Organizations and concerned citizens, vetohh hopes to make a difference in a Veteran's life, one Vet at time.
results.name: Veteran's Helping Hands (Vetohh)

Stay in touch - Be inspired

Argentina Rosado Yoga - Facebook Page

www.argentinarosadoyoga.com

Welcome! This is a group for anyone & everyone who want to chill out and have fun independent of relationship status. One basic rule: No one asks anyone for relationship status unless one volunteers to share. Join in if you are interested in Social Networking, Fun Times, Dining Out, Wine, Adventure, Coffee, Laughter, Good Conversation, Friendships, Connecting with Like-minded People, Self Exploration, Nightlife…. "You’re cheating yourself out of today. Today is calling to you, trying to get your attention, but you’re stuck on tomorrow, and today trickles away like water down a drain. You wake up the next morning and that today you wasted is gone forever. It’s now yesterday. Some of those moments may have had wonderful things in store for you , but now you’ll never know.” 

Jerry Spinelli, Love, Stargirl

results.description: Ever wanted to discuss wine or try a varietal that you don't know much about? results.description:
We are a community of people for whom just drinking wine is not enough. We have all levels of experience and while not in the industry, always look for opportunities to learn about wine. 

One Friday a month, we hire a wine educator to pick out wines and take us through a tasting based on a topic of our choosing. Generally, we do one round of tasting without food and then we go back to our favorites while socializing over snacks. The idea of this gathering is to learn the basics of tasting while going through different wine regions and styles throughout the world. 

Occasionally we have field trips to different wine bars or wine centric places in NYC (Manhattan or Brooklyn) to do tastings there. These are less formal than our monthly tastings and let us learn about the different people, places, and perspectives through NYC.

In terms of cost, Wine Club members split the cost of all events. Non-restaurant events are usually hosted in one of our apartments - typically in Brooklyn by the Barclays Center but any member can offer to host.

results.description:
We're New Yorkers who love mountains and passionate about learning the craft of climbing big mountains, the last true sport (if I may).

This group is meant to bring together like minded folks to develop camaraderie and find training and climbing partners. Mountains are hard. So why not train together.

The focus of the group is on training various aspects of alpine mountaineering, with hands on approach and shared learning.

This may include:

- Long day hikes and backpacking trips

- Winter camping

- Ice climbing

- Outdoor rock climbing

- Backcountry Skiing

- Gym and outdoor training

- Trail running

- Glacier Travel skills

It takes a long time to learn the ways of mountains, to be able enjoy them with reasonable margin of safety. Please note that everyone here is a student as well as a teacher. So it essential that everyone brings something to the table. If you've any experience in any of above, and have big goals, come train with us.

Strong hikers are also welcome.

results.description: Alternative Recovery Help for the other 95%! Help for those who refuse to see themselves as diseased! Help for those who refuse to identify themselves as alcoholics and addicts! Help for those who refuse to believe that they should identify themselves as addicts when they have made the CHOICE to stop using and abusing substances. Help for those who need to network and socialize with an element of support to work toward the changes that are needed to gain complete freedom for self-medicating and all the behaviors and beliefs that come with the old lifestyle. Help that is working for other like-minded individuals who are on the road to freedom; help for the other 95%! There are many people who are frustrated. They want help but find that their options are extremely limited. It is an area that still only offers a basic fit; a one-size fits all option. This field continues to base its focus on outdated information. Despite the research and science-based findings in this area, the professionals are continuing to look at it through outdated lenses and use outdated information and approaches. Too many people are falling through those cracks! I have decided to take my experience and education and offer another approach. The approach is science-based and walks you through a self-help approach of inner healing. It also offers a social network in the community and online called the Dry Bar. If you have found you have a need for these things in your life and want to find freedom from the desire for drugs and alcohol or other behaviors and haven’t gotten your needs me elsewhere, this may be for you. Welcome to a new approach. Welcome to freedom. Welcome to choice. Welcome to Alternative Recovery.
results.name: Lyndhurst Recovery Meetup, Help for the Other 95%

results.description:
This group is for digital product designers who are interested in exploring the experience between physical and digital space. How can we bring the same design thinking we do for digital products into the physical space? How can we make the everyday apps we already use more interesting with in-real-life touch points? How might we create in-real-life buttons that create digital trails? This is a group for product designers, experimenters and people interested in the intersection between physical and digital things to come together and prototype ideas quickly. We'll host workshops around design challenges so you can make time for experimentation and play outside of work. Design challenges we might try:

• Create something that fixes an annoying problem you face every day.
• Create something that makes your favorite app come to life.
• Create something that makes people laugh
• Create something to help strangers start talking to each other.
• Create something that replaces the last thing you threw away yesterday.

We’ll use kits from LittleBits™— inputs like the Button, Motion Trigger and slide dimmer, connect with the CloudBit and IFTTT to make your offline buttons come to life. 

What is LittleBits™?

littleBits is a platform of easy-to-use electronic building blocks that empower you to invent anything, from your own remote controlled car, to a smart home device. The Bits snap together with magnets, no soldering, no wiring, no programming needed.

Meetups will be held at the LittleBits™ pop-up store in SoHo.
results.name: NYC Makers Meetup

results.description:
FUTSAL ON SUNDAY AFTERNOONS

MUST RSVP ONLINE

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. 

Start time is 12pm and will run until 2:30pm. 

Gym floor, so wear flats. 1 flight upstairs from entrance door.

No goalies, so NO GOALKEEPING

We will play 10-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

 Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. 

Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

That's it. So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.


                       ~~~~@☢🎱☣⚽️⚖⚽️🎱☣☢@~~~~


FUTSAL DOMINGOS POR LA TARDE

HAY QUE RESERVAR EN LINEA

Podras reservar para jugadores multiples hasta que se llenen los cupos.

Comenzamos a las 12pm y jugamos hasta las 2:30pm

Se juega sobre piso de gimnasio asi que usen zapatos de "indoor"

No hay porteros, asi que NO SE PUEDE PORTEREAR

Se jugaran partidos de 10 minutos (ganadores siguen vivos). Habran 3 equipos de 5 jugadores (4 mas 1 cambio). El primero en anotar 3 goles gana el partido. Ganadores deberan seguir ganando para continuar vivos. Empates consecutivos se definirán por moneda.

Barridas estan Absolutamente Prohibidas

Por favor entiendan que para mantener este grupo acivo deberemos prohibir cualquier tipo de pelea o altercado. Todo aquel o aquella que pelee sera excluido (a) del grupo permanentemente. 

Eso es todo. Asi que Vamos a Jugar!   Para cualquier consulta, por favor contacteme atravez de meetup.com.
results.name: Are You Ready for Some FUTBOL!!!!!!!!!

results.description: Do you look at the mirror often and obsess about a flaw? Do you think when you go out everyone is shunning you because of a specific "flaw?"Does your low self-esteem hinder you from engaging in normal social activities? Do feel stressed at the notion of having to mingle at a birthday or holiday party?  I suffer from these types of insecurities, stresses, and obsessions and wanted to start a group where people who have BDD (Body Dysmorphic Disorder) and Social Anxiety Disorder (SAD) could get support by talking things through. I have been diagnosed with BDD and have isolated myself from many facets of life for the last few years. I am starting this group with no lofty ambition other then to connect those who feel that they have become imprisoned by low self-esteem, social anxiety, and distorted body/face image. Perhaps through sharing our stories we can heal and feel less alone.  If you would like to come to a meetup please tell me a little about yourself. I am also starting this meetup because there is no other BDD support group I could find locally.
results.name: West Orange Body Dysmorphic & Social Anxiety Meetup

results.description:
This is a group for people who would like to get up early on Sunday mornings to talk about great books over some coffee or tea with like-minded fellow New Yorkers. 

When and where to meet? 

-- Meeting twice a month, at a cafe or restaurant in Manhattan, on Sunday mornings. The core discussion time is from 8:30 - 9:30 am. The social time, which is optional, is 30 minutes before and after the discussion time. (I.E., 8:00 - 8:30 am and 9:30 -10:00 am). You can use the social time to eat breakfast, brunch or to just chat. 

How the books are chosen? 

-- Anyone who volunteers to be a facilitator of a meeting has the right to choose the book to discuss for that meeting and the exact location to meet. 

At the initial stage, let's choose the books from the following three book lists: 

1. All-Time 100 Novels (chosen by Time Magazine) http://entertainment.time.com/2005/10/16/all-time-100-nov... 

2. Winners of Pulitzer Prize in Biography or Autobiography Category http://www.pulitzer.org/bycat/Biography-or-Autobiography 

3. Oprah's Book Club list http://static.oprah.com/pdf/obc-complete-list.pdf 

Any Fees in becoming a member and attending a meeting?

There are no fees to become a member of this Meetup group. 

However, to RSVP for a meeting, a refundable $5 reservation fee will be charged to encourage better attendance. If a member shows up on time (i.e. by 8:30am), $4 will be refunded. The remaining $1 will be used to cover the administration fees that the organizer has to pay to Meetup.com.
results.name: Early Risers' Book Club

results.description:
Welcome to the meetup page for New York City chapter of National Women's Liberation. National Women's Liberation (NWL) is a new feminist group with old roots. The organization was born from a collaboration between organizers from Redstockings and Gainesville Women's Liberation (FL) which started in 1968. We are a dynamic and diverse group of women in the fight against male supremacy, developing theory alongside our actions. An integral part of our organization is the Women of Color Caucus (WOCC) which meets separately from white women to better understand how white supremacy intersects with other forms of oppression. Our group hosts public meetings the third Tuesday of every month at The Commons at 388 Atlantic Ave, and all women are welcome.

NWL won a big victory in 2013 when the Morning-After Pill was put over the counter for all ages, the fruits of a 10-year battle that included a sit-in at the FDA, illegally giving out the pill to show the ridiculousness of the restrictions, and a class action lawsuit. Current priorities are the right to abortion and birth control and the overthrow of the double day--women's roles as full-time caretakers and full time employees. Most recently, we printed and distributed 1969 "This Oppresses Women" stickers after reviving them from the Redstockings Archive. We got a lot of publicity when they were used against Protein World's Beach Body ads in Union Square, and they continue to appear on other offending ads all over the city. NWL feminists are also organizing the #ShoutYourAbortion campaign in NYC.

We are a group for women who want to fight back against male supremacy and win more freedom for women. We believe that change comes about from the actions of everyday people—not politicians, the courts, lobbyists, or the media. The freedoms we have now were won by movements of women, organizing and fighting for change. Men did not become less sexist or decide to give women the vote or legalize birth control because of our individual abilities to reason with them, educate them, or because they love us so much. The inequalities between women and men are political problems that require a collective solution.


Check out womensliberation.org to get involved.

Unless specifically noted, all events are for women only. Thank you!
results.name: National Women's Liberation: Feminist Activism NYC

results.description:
StackiLab NYC is a meetup for those interested in learning about Stacki, server provisioning, configuration management, and DevOps while meeting others in their area who share the same interests. 

Stacki is an open source CentOS/RHEL bare metal provisioning tool that can take your servers from bare hardware (or virtual hardware) to working Linux, ready to install applications. Stacki does this at scale, so deploying 1000+ servers is no more complex than deploying one. Once your servers are installed with Stacki, you can augment them with configuration tools like Puppet, Chef, Salt, CFEngine, Ansible, etc. 


Visit www.stacki.com to learn more and join the Stacki community here: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/stacki
results.name: StackiLab NYC

results.description:
Come out and Meetup with like-minded individuals ready to serve communities locally and abroad while challenging themselves and growing in faith and fellowship.

Christian Adventure Missions
You’ll Know What To Do When You Get There
Transformational Spiritual and Life Changing Trip For Christians. Zmission experiences awaken your mind and inspire your soul while creating profound and lasting spiritual changes in your life.

Much More Than A Trip
Take an adventure trip that will not only help to transform you but also make a difference in the local community.

Where God’s Taking You
Is god calling you to make a difference in the world? To serve something greater than yourself? Whether he has been tapping you on the shoulder for years or has recently showed up in your life we are here TO SERVE. We are all called TO SERVE… Are you ready?
If you choose to serve, to disciple, to seek wise council, and to share fellowship with other Christians experiencing the grace of god through purpose-driven adventure missions trips then Zmissions is for you.

Travel With Purpose and Impact
Zmissions adventures are long, hard, and sometimes painful, but also transformational, rewarding, and fun. They will bring you much joy and fulfillment. You will continue to push your limits long after the trip is over, knowing “JESUS CHRIST MY LORD AND GOD IN YOU I PUT MY TRUST” Through all the chaos, adventure, and unconditional love, you find what has been missing in your life. These experiences will absolutely transform your life and outlook, but most importantly by putting your faith in Jesus, and believing he can provide everything and more, you will experience a level of living a life that many only dream about.

Feel the Power of God
Feeling the power of God through Discipleship and Fellowship. This became apparent during our first Zmission. It was truly a humbling and eye-opening experience. As we sat together in fellowship after traveling thousands of miles, we realized that we were there to Serve in any way needed and without judgment. Guidance came in the form of wise council trusting in God and seeking his word. To feel the power of God, let go and trust in him and your life will be transformed. Jesus shows up in our lives in powerful ways and guides us along our journeys

What We Can Do to Serve
There are many ways TO SERVE communities around the world and gives new found hope to people who may not have had hope before through Christ. This means bringing groups together to transform lives and opening minds to new realities by embodying the unconditional love of Jesus. It also means we are never above the communities and individuals we serve. No task is to small. We will serve around the world where there is need and you will impact the world in a positive way while making a difference in thousands of people lives along the way.

You’ll Know What To Do When You Get There
Where God leads you next, and the blessings he will bestow will absolutely blow your mind. Where ever we go, what ever we do, when we get there we do what is needed Period. All you have to do is show up and the big man above will handle the rest. What will you do next? Did you feel it? Will you answer the call to SERVE.

Zmissions Team
Jon Christian – Mission Leader

God began taping me on the shoulder at an early age. I remember it like it was yesterday. I”d always been naturally rebellious and found it hard to accept what was taught at Sunday school. Sound Familiar? At the age of about 7, I realized there was something missing while sitting in Church services. I felt like God had a bigger plan. A plan for me to SERVE!

Years passed while my searched continued for connection, purpose, and impact until the day my perspective was changed forever… at my feet written as clear as the day was…”JESUS IS THE WAY”. That was the day I was CALLED SERVE.

I found myself standing on the farthest rock in the ocean I could find. I’d been traveling for miles with 50 lbs. of gear and had not seen my family in two months. As the sun began to set the sky had lit up like fire. The contrast between the blue ocean and the sky was unlike anything I have ever seen before. It was as if God himself was staring back at me looking deep within my soul. My hair began to stand up the same way it had when I found “JESUS IS THE WAY” written in concrete so many years before. A voice from within, not the voice you hear from internal conversations you have in your head on a normal day, this was all encompassing vibrating energy coming from both outside and within, it was coming from my heart and the entire world around me. The words spoken to me were “WELL DONE, YOU MADE IT…NOW GO AND TELL THE WORLD.

The adventures and the journey are long, hard, and sometimes painful, but also transformational, rewarding, and have brought much joy and fulfillment in my life. I continue to push my limits, praying “JESUS CHRIST MY LORD AND GOD IN YOU I PUT MY TRUST” Through all the chaos and adventure, and a chance meeting with my Guardian Angel who taught me what unconditional love is I had found what I had been looking for since the age of 7. These experiences have absolutely transformed my life and outlook but most importantly by putting my faith in Jesus and believing he could provide everything and more that we needed I experienced a level of living a life that many only dream about.

Where God lead me next, and the blessings he bestowed on me to this day absolutely blow my mind. Where ever we go, what ever we do, when we get there we do what is needed Period. All you have to do is show up and the big man above will handle the rest. What will you do next? Did you feel it? Will you answer the call to SERVE.

After a long and sometimes lonely journey, I’ve found wise counsel and fellowship in Christ. Now it’s your turn, we climb this mountain and embark on the adventure together.

John Albino – Mission Leader

John Albino started Absolute Music Studios with one goal in mind… to create a warm and inviting musical atmosphere that he himself would want to come to. It all started with the desire to live a more community-oriented life and to be around to raise his children instead of living on the road, which he did for many years. John has worked with musicians from many of the biggest names in the music business over the years, including KISS, The Pretenders, Wings, Billy Joel, Foreigner, Pat Travers and Quiet Riot, to name a few.

He has also worked as a studio musician, playing on sessions with many top producers including Stephen Gelfas and Charlie Midnight.
Now he has created a first class music studio staffed with the best player-teachers in the area. He brings decades of musical expertise and the benefit of years of front-line professional experience to Absolute Music, his own unique creation. Using that experience as a musician and a vision to guide him, he set out to build a studio where many could come and pursue their passion for music in a warm and inviting family-oriented atmosphere, while being taught by the finest teachers available. Absolute Music is now firmly established as one of the best and busiest music lesson studios in the area. John’s continual dedication to and involvement with the surrounding communities plays a crucial role in his success, while also providing community enrichment through music.

results.description: This group provides a safe space to explore how yoga and mindfulness can help make a difference in your life, reduce stress, start living in the present moment and lead to better self-care. I am Diana S. Ramos, a Registered Dietitian/Nutritionist and yoga instructor. I practice a mind-body approach to nutrition and well-being, and empower each individual to develop a healthy relationship with their bodies, mind and food. My mission is to help individuals thrive into a more joyful, healthy and mindful lives. I discovered the real benefits of yoga in the most difficult times in my life. I was at my peak levels of stress, anxiety and unhappiness. Yoga helped me find peace within myself. Through the practice of yoga I discovered that stress, anxiety and unhappiness were rooted from not living and accepting the present moment. I noticed I was either in living in the past or worrying about the future, but never present moment, in what is. Yoga helped me to kindly move into the present moment, decrease self-judgement, and cultivate self-compassion, self-love and self-acceptance. I would like to share this experience and practice with you. This group offers yoga and wellness workshops, to help you dive into the present moment, release stress and anxiety, and help you to compassionately take care of you. Allow yoga to help you connect with your body. Yoga is not about how flexible you are but how flexible you can become on your mat and in real life with you and your thoughts. Yoga is not about competing, comparing, or judging, it is about self-acceptance, self-love and self-compassion. Yoga is a practice where no experience necessary. The only requirement is you and an open mind. This is an invitation to take care of your body and mind. My Motto: Embrace. Love. Nurture. Embrace who you are. Love yourself just as you are. In order to Nurture yourself the right way.
results.name: Nourish Body & Mind

results.description:
Marketing Professionals Meetup welcomes all entrepreneurs, business owners and like-minded professionals who want to boost their marketing techniques to improve sales and strengthen their professional and career positions.

We share ideas, collaborate on projects, and help each other by identifying resources, strategies, tools and knowledge directly beneficial to our community.

Many of our members have a special interest in marketing automation, digital content marketing, native advertising, social selling with a focus on sharing of experiences and results from their use.


Membership Requirements:

This is a private professional group and all new members require prior approval by the Organizer before admittance.

To apply for membership, here's what you'll need to do:

•  Profile Questions: Please provide answers to all questions. This is an important opportunity for members to get to know each other online before meeting in person.

•  Profile Photo: Please provide a professional photograph with face only. 

--- Do not leave blank or use any inappropriate images or pictures of business logos, cats, dogs, birds, or other. 

--- No full body shots; photos must be headshots that clearly represent you, and it is required that only the applying member is in the photograph. 


Our Meetups are informal and always free.

Our networking events are where we connect, exchange thoughts and get feedback about our endeavors and most of all have a great time getting together with old friends and making new ones!

We're aiming to keep all Meetups free and are usually very likely to get together at small venues such as coffee shops, restaurants, or public spaces. 

Hope you can join us.

Looking forward to meeting up with you!


Zorka Kovacevich

Meetup Organizer

Though it doesn’t sound like it, WorldChoiceModels (WCM) is all about photography! However, what makes us different than the average "photography meetup" is how we work. Overall, WorldChoiceModels is run by myself and the models, where the models create themed events for this community of photographers.  Photographers are invited to attend, for a fee, where they  to come to take pictures, learn from each other, and enjoy! NO TFP work!  Photographers are not expected nor are they required to provide images to the models! The models are compensated for their time. 

We take pride in the fact that creativity, affordability, and dependability is what WorldChoiceModels will be known for in the community of photographers. 

Models: This group's intention is to have the models host events and function as part of the leadership team of the group. Models are always encouraged to join the group, if interested in hosting events, please contact us directly. WCM Models are hospitable, dependable, creative, hard-working and have a drive for success. Join us! 

Photographers: All are welcome! No matter how much experience you have. WorldChoiceModels is a place where photographers can network, and effortlessly practice, practice, practice, while working with reliable and talented models. We welcome all photographers who want to be creative, learn new skills, perfect old ones, and have fun.

We love what we do, but more importantly, we love sharing what we do. 

Join us and attend our many shooting opportunities. 

Cheers,
WorldChoiceModels 
John Bodensiek, Founder

Join us at our monthly Shamanic Circle, in Northern, NJ, where we learn about and experience the beauty and magick of Shamanism through Journey work. Journeying is a core element of the shamanic practice that is attained through drumming. It opens the doors to other realms of consciousness and altered states of being. This allows us to connect and work with guides and helpers and to receive messages/direction and/or to access deep states of healing with intention. 

Whether it is your first time or you are familiar with journeying, you are welcome to join! This is a safe and sacred space where all paths are welcome.  

Bring a notebook and pen to document your experience, bandana/eye cover, sacred item(s) to put on the altar, and hand-held instruments. Wear comfortable clothing.

RSVP/More Info ~ Cristina Maria via Meet-up

Cost ~ $20 Adults (over 25 yrs), $5 Young Adults, Teens, and Children (over 10 yrs - 25 yrs) 

This is a reoccurring circle every 3rd Friday of the month (Next Circle ~ Friday, December 18th) ~ due to special circumstances, this month we are hosting the circle on the 3rd Wednesday.

results.description:
What we are about?

This Meetup group is for people that are willing to meet in the name of Jesus Christ from house to house and in public places. We want to meet at least once a week, to speak of Jesus Christ and the Scriptures, to pray together, to continue in the apostles teachings and in fellowship, and in the breaking of bread.

It is written, there is one who scatters, yet increases more; and there is one who withholds more than is right, but it leads to poverty. This group is to "scatter" the word of God, to give free course to the Scriptures. As long as we are willing to rightly divide the word of truth, every man and woman has a part in the conversation. We can edify each other in love. I put one block of truth, and you can put another block of truth.

You can expect to be part of a spiritual conversation, and the opportunity to exercise your spiritual gifts as long as we do all things decently and in order. When we come together, every single member has. One has a psalm, another a doctrine, someone else a tongue, another one a revelation, the next man an interpretation. Let all things be done for edifying of the body of Christ.

The Gospel

The Gospel of Jesus Christ is the glad tidings of the kingdom of God unto the meek, liberty to the captives, and the opening of the prison to them that are bound, the proclamation of the day of salvation, the acceptable year of the Lord (Isa 52:6-7, 61:1-2, Luk 4:18-19, 8:1); whereby God sent and anointed his son Jesus Christ to preach the Gospel and to be the saviour of the world. (1 Jn 4:14) The Gospel of Jesus Christ is the power of God unto salvation to everyone that believes whether Jew or Greek (Rom 1:16-17) to all them that call upon him (Rom 10:12-15). For therein is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith.  The Gospel declares that Christ died for our sins according to the scriptures, he was buried, and rose again the third day according to the scriptures, that he was seen of Cephas, the twelve and then of five hundred brethren at once. (1 Cor 15:1-3) Through the Gospel we understand that that the stone which was rejected is become the head of the corner.  Jesus Christ who was rejected and crucified rose again the third day according to the scriptures, and is now exalted far above all principalities and powers (Ps 118:22-23, Mat 21:42, Acts 4:10-12, 1 Cor 15:1-3, Eph 1:20-21). This tried stone is none other than Jesus Christ; whose name is called Wonderful, Counsellor, The Mighty God, The everlasting Father, The Prince of Peace. (Isa 7:10-14, Mat 1:21-23; Is 8:10-18, 9:6-7; 1 Pet 2:4-8). This is the true God and eternal life (1 Jn 5:20).

An essential part of the gospel is understanding what it means that Jesus is the Christ.  It is written, that He whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for God did not give the Spirit by measure unto Him (Jn 3:34). This verse speaks of Jesus of Nazareth, a body that God prepared, so that the fullness of the Father would be manifested in him (Heb 10:5). As the Scripture says, For in him dwelleth all the fullness of the Godhead bodily (Col 1:19).  This is the mystery of Christ, even the mystery of godliness. God was manifest in the flesh, justified in the Spirit, seen of angels, preached unto the Gentiles, believed on in the world, received up into glory (1Ti 3:16). He that sees Jesus, sees Him that sent him (Jn 12:45). This is to the mind that has understanding. The name of the Father is Jesus. The name of the Son is Jesus. The name of the Holy Ghost is Jesus. These are spiritual words, and they owe to be discerned spiritually. This is what Jesus meant, when he said that he was the Son of God. For since the very beginning it was written, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness (Gen 1:16). Jesus Christ is that man, he is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of every creature (Col 1:15). God was in Christ, and not another. I repeat again, Christ received the Spirit of God without measure. The prophet Isaiah foresaw this and speaking as the oracles of God wrote that a child will be born unto us, that a son will be given. And that his name shall be called the mighty God, the everlasting Father. We are also called to be partakers of such fullness, to come in the unity of the faith, the knowledge of the Son of God, to grow unto that perfect man, unto the measure and stature of Christ (Eph 4:13). We are also called to receive the Spirit of Christ. God will give us the Holy Ghost if we obey Him (Acts 5:32). Men and brethren, what must we do in order to obey God?

Jesus Christ came preaching repentance and that the kingdom of heaven is at hand (Mat 4:17). In order to enter into the kingdom of God we must be born again of the water and of the Spirit (Jn 3:3-5). Those early disciples in the book of Acts were born again when they repented, were baptized in the name of Jesus Christ (born of the water), and received the infilling of the Holy Ghost (born of the Spirit). (Acts 2:37-41, 8:12-17, 9:17-18, 10:44-48, 19:1-6) The baptisms in the book of Acts were done in the name of Jesus Christ (Acts 2:38, 4:12, 8:12, 10:48, 19:5, Gal 3:27, Rom 6:3-4, Col 2:12). In order to obey the Gospel and enter into the kingdom of God we too must do what those early disciples did and what Jesus commanded. Repent therefore, and be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of your sins and you too shall receive the gift of the Holy Ghost (Acts 2:38-39). Please take the time to look up the scriptures listed in this study (Acts 17:11).

results.description:
this group accomplishes two things. since I just moved to Montclair, I need and want to establish a support network of women who are also stay at home moms.  I was part of a Hoboken mom's group and those 13 women kept my head above water! So since I just want a time to meet people like me, aka, stay at home moms who have secure babysitting where they can finally afford to spend a little time with other lady friends, have made the choice to be a stay at home mom for a while until their kids gets older, and love Montclair like me. lol but seriously I do think this is a better town than rumson, red bank, westfield, spring lake, you name it. ha ha  There is a rule if you miss three meetups and do not have a good reason, then you are out of the group.

now the second purpose is to do something with all those pictures and memorabilia I have in my closet.  I WANT to learn the art of scrapbooking and what a better way to do it than laughing with other ladies.  on your first meetup please bring a scrapbook, a sharpie and as many pictures and memorabilia as you want and you can bring more stuff if you "just happen to have it."  Also I imagine you need some glue, pins, or a way to stick things onto you your scrapbook.  either way we can talk about it over coffee and have a good laugh.  There is a 10 dollar fee, I changed it because I think it pays for the group and everyone will probably be generous with any item or knowledge they can share about scrapbooking.  Cant wait to meet you.  There are three scrapbooking stores I know of:  Michaels, AC Moore, and a hidden little gem in the mall that lies on the cusp of Montclair and Glen Ridge. (where the 7-11 is and the Panera and smash burger)


Cheers,

Piper
results.name: Montclair Stay at Home Mom  "Let's Try Some Scrapbooking!"

This group is for anyone interested in enhancing the quality of their lives and their community. If you are tired of the 9-5 treadmill and seeking a new and better life, than being trapped in a corporate cubical, than this group is for you. I want this group to be an open forum where ideas, thoughts, concerns, and feelings can be discuss and exchanged in a very supportive and friendly atmosphere. 

Whether you just graduated from college or retired from your job, this group is right for you if your looking to challenge yourself, to take that next step and explore other options in a welcoming environment. This group is for you if your ready to break out of your shell and listen to that little voice inside your head that keeps telling you to do more, be more have more.

This group is devoted to your success, ideas and beliefs, that by thinking in a certain way, anything is achievable and possible. That the rules of the universe work for everyone all the time every time.  We will study the lives of successful people, and talk about what made them successful. We will read books to inspire us and teach us how to think like and act like successful people. We will develop.  our minds and thinking to attract to us all that we desire and want.

results.description:
FetNet Arts & Events is an authentic fet-alt community.

This is your opportunity to explore the fet-alt culture and meet like-minded friends . 

Please do note that we are a dues paying organization; basic membership ($20/month). 

Options: 

Sign up annually and get 3 months for free; or quarterly and get the first month free.

We will offer members unprecedented opportunities to connect with kinksters and fet-alt artists both locally and globally. Our companion site DsNation will provide a playspace where D/s lovers can connect for close encounters and more.  The FetNet app will enable members to share personal video content and view pro galleries,streaming content and events from around the world.  Our member-driven forums will keep FetNet members up-to-date on local niche kink events as well as major festivals and expos.

Please do include a very descriptive profile as to your interest and preferences.

Don't forget your sexiest pics/videos. ;-)~

Our vision...

 is about safe, real-world interactions and exploration. So don't be shy. Our event planners will assist you in  organizing your event at a local club, private residence--or even plan a sexy cruise. They will help you locate exotic destinations for the perfect fantasy get-away at a deep group discount.

FetNet brings fantasies to life...

Our Meetup group, is part of the cultural shift certainly bought to all our attention by the "50 Shades of Grey" phenomenon. While the series is often described as the cult fiction that we all love to hate--one thing is clear: There's a lot of curiosity about fet-alt erotica. Obviously-- vanilla erotica is limited, uninspiring or perhaps just plain boring to millions of women around the world who made this series a singular success.

Who will fill the void?

Many of the sites claiming to be fetish-friendly are merely gratuitous porn. We will be a platform for the fet-alt creatives and curious members who wish to explore the so called kink culture. We will do this by sharing information in our forums and promoting sex- positive discussions.

Our member-driven activities will encourage Safe Sane Consensual play. FetNet is community-based but will also expose members to fet-alt activities around the world. Our FetNet directories/calendar will connect you to artists, vendors, service providers,fet-alt galleries,events and relevant groups. We encourage fet-alt creatives to list in our directories and expand your reach as we grow.

Join us because:
"A Fantasy is a terrible thing to waste."
results.name: FetNet Arts & Events

results.description:
Calling all Yoga Teachers, Yoga Therapists, Yoga Studios, Fitness Professionals, Bodyworkers (massage therapists, Reiki, Acupuncturists), and Meditation coaches. This meet-up is about the Business of Yoga, Fitness and Wellness in the New York Metro area. YES; our market is crowded and competitive, making it difficult to compete for the next gig. Does it have to be this way? 

The number one dilemma from wellness professionals I meet: How can you live your passion and get paid accordingly without compromising your lifestyle? How can you pay rent in this expensive city from doing what you love instead of what you love to do being the thing that you are moonlighting with.  It's time for a breakthrough, a better business strategy, more "Benjamins" and better Bottom Line. 

8 years ago, I decided to stop doing the things that I hate and start doing what I love. I became a full-time fitness professional: personal trainer, group exercise instructor and yoga instructor.  I was penniless more often than not, until I stopped competing for gigs and started creating my own lane. This meet-up is for 1) the fitness professionals that are creating their own lane, making money doing what they love, living the yogi life without compromise and 2) those that dreaming/wishing/waiting to be financial independent from their "day jobs" to do their "life's work". 

Lets meet for networking; let's meet for strategy sessions; let's meet for website review; let's meet for marketing tips; let's meet to find your desire map; let's meet to talk niche and strategic allies; lets talk about having your Om-Grown Business!
results.name: New York Metro Yogi-prenuer Business Meetup

results.description:
Girl Talk 101 MeetUp group is for woman of all ages who are interested in looking and feeling their very best. Get the insider's scoop on the retail marketing of products and end the confusion of the shelves' trial & error.  

Let's face it. Most women have a love-hate relationship with their makeup & their skin care. The lack of knowledge & education available to the consumer is scary to be frank. Misleading labels in the nutrition, skincare and cosmetic industry has caused many of us all to spend so much money on products that simply don't perform the way you thought they would. The one size fits all philosophy has never worked for me, and if you are of the same thinking, this group is for you. 

My passion is to share with you what I have learned over the years and bring new understanding to you on how our bodies work; from the inside out. Learn how your skin functions & ages and how to treat it on any budget. Customize your makeup regimen from the right foundation to the perfect finishing touches.    Discover how your digestive health affects every organ of your body, and how to adjust accordingly. 

Come out and join us for fun & informative skin & makeup workshops which cover all the beauty basics and then some! Let's end the madness, share our experiences and empower each other. 

All are welcome with reservations appreciated for each workshop, the first one is my gift to you. Choose your interest, mark your calendar, and we'll see you soon!

Let the beauty of what you love, show in everything you do.

Jodi Usher         

www.shopusher.com
results.name: Girl Talk 101
